titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frederick A. Smith, Album
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:57
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Autograph MSS.
Collection of more than 500 letters, signatures, etc., of British statesmen, authors, scientists, etc.; Smith was employed by J. & J. Colman Ltd. at Norwich; members of the Colman family of Carrow House, Norwich, contributed significantly to this collection; many letters in these albums are addressed to Jeremiah James Colman (1830-1899), who was M.P. for Norwich from 1871-1895, or to his son-in-law James Stuart, P.C., M.P (1843-1913); other contributors to the collection were the Rev. Mr. Barrett of Norwich, and Timothy Cole (1852-1931); the collection is strong in liberal politicians and nonconformist clergy, and many of the letters concern activities in which Smith was interested and which took place in and around Norwich.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn d66 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frederick A. Smith, Album. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a partial inventory of the contents of Osborn d66. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.
